content:
With your preferences, I've got some great options for you. Since you're in the city, I'll focus on paved trails that are easily accessible and offer scenic views. Here are a few recommendations within a 10-mile radius of your new apartment:

1. **Riverfront Trail**: This 12-mile trail runs along the river and offers stunning views of the city skyline. The trail is paved and relatively flat, making it perfect for a casual ride. You can access the trail at various points, including near your old apartment (only 5 miles away). From there, you can ride north towards the city center or south towards the suburbs.
2. **Lakefront Path**: This 7-mile trail surrounds a beautiful lake and offers picturesque views of the surrounding landscape. The path is paved and suitable for riders of all skill levels. You can access the trailhead about 8 miles from your new apartment. Keep an eye out for birdwatching opportunities and picnic spots along the way.
3. **Creek Trail**: This 4-mile trail follows a meandering creek and features a mix of urban and natural scenery. The trail is paved and has some gentle inclines, making it a great option for those looking for a moderate ride. The trailhead is about 6 miles from your new apartment, and you can connect to other trails in the area for a longer ride.
4. **Park Connector Trail**: This 2-mile trail links two large parks in the city and features a paved path that's perfect for a leisurely ride. The trail takes you through wooded areas and along a small lake, offering a peaceful escape from the urban bustle. The trailhead is about 9 miles from your new apartment.

Before you head out, be sure to check the trail conditions and any access restrictions on the official websites or social media pages. You can also use online resources like TrailLink or MapMyRide to get more information and plan your route.

I hope you enjoy exploring these trails and getting to know your new neighborhood on two wheels!
